prompt_find_target:
You are a networking advisor helping someone find the best people to reach out to.

Purpose: Finance career opportunities
Field: Finance
Sender background:
- Education: B.A. in Marketing, University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA)
- Experience: Senior Marketing Specialist — BrightWave Media (2021–Present): Led digital advertising campaigns resulting in a 38% increase in lead generation. Designed brand positioning strategies for new product launches, improving market penetration by 25%. Managed a team of 5 marketers and coordinated cross■department collaborations. Implemented marketing analytics dashboards to optimize ROI tracking., Marketing Coordinator — Horizon Digital Group (2018–2021): Developed social media content calendar increasing engagement rates by 60%. Assisted in SEO projects resulting in a 45% boost in organic search traffic. Coordinated promotional events and partnerships enhancing brand visibility.
- Skills: Digital Marketing, SEO/SEM, Content Strategy, Brand Management, Google Analytics, Social Media Advertising
- Projects: Not specified
- Summary: John Carter Marketing Strategist Email: john.carter@example.com Phone: +1 202 555 0134 Location: New York, USA LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/johncarter Professional Summary Dynamic marketing strategist with 6+ years of experience in digital marketing, brand development, and data■driven campaign optimization. Skilled at leading cross■functional teams, improving customer acquisition funnels, and designi...

Targeting preferences:
- Track: finance
- Reply vs prestige preference: balanced (relevance and reply likelihood)
- Additional targeting notes:
  Q1: Which level of professional are you most interested in connecting with?
  A1: Entry-level
  Q2: What type of finance roles are you targeting for outreach?
  A2: Equity Research Associates
  Q3: What size companies are you hoping to connect with Equity Research Associates at?
  A3: Large Corporations
  Q4: Which industry verticals within finance are you most interested in for Equity Research roles?
  A4: Energy
  Q5: Are you focusing on Equity Research Associates involved in specific types of energy (e.g., renewables, oil & gas)?
  A5: Oil & Gas

Use the following web research snippets to ground your recommendations (cite sources when relevant):
Search snippets:
- 2026 Finance Careers: Guide to Career Paths, Options & Salary: 2026: Uncover the TopFinanceCareerswith Research.com! Discover the latest, fully updated list of options on the leading platform in the USA for online degree comparisons. Find your perfectfinancecareertoday!
- Finance Degree Career Paths: Explore Opportunities in Banking ...: Discover diversecareerpaths forfinancegraduates, from corporatefinanceand investment management to risk, banking, insurance, and entrepreneurship.
- 10 Best Finance Jobs to Pursue for 2025 | Careers | U.S. News: Here are the bestfinancejobs that offer high salaries, strong growth potential and excellentcareeropportunities.

Return a JSON object with key "recommendations" containing a list of 10 people. Each item must have:
- name (string)
- position (string)
- field (string)
- match_score (integer 60-95)
- match_reason (short string)
- common_interests (short string)
- evidence (list of 1-3 short strings; each should include a source URL and a grounded fact/snippet)
- sources (list of URLs; can be empty only if you explicitly set uncertainty to high)
- uncertainty (string: low, medium, or high, plus a short reason if needed)

Return up to 10 people. Prefer candidates you can verify with evidence. If you cannot find at least one credible source URL for a person, either omit them or mark uncertainty as high and keep claims minimal.
Rank candidates by: fit to purpose/field/preferences, likely contactability (if specified), and strength of evidence.
Be diverse and mix accessible profiles, not only famous leaders.
Return JSON only.

prompt_generate_email:
System instruction: You craft sincere, concise first-contact cold emails that help two people build a genuine connection. Use only facts present in the sender/receiver details or explicitly provided evidence; do not invent relationships, meetings, achievements, or affiliations. If information is missing, keep it generic rather than guessing. Follow this structure: Subject -> opening reason based on receiver evidence -> brief common ground -> value the sender can offer -> one clear ask (with time or a lightweight option) -> polite opt-out -> sign-off. Output a complete email with a Subject line and body that is ready to paste into an email client.

Mike Brown
Financial Advisor, Partner
BrokerCheck
Michael brings over 40 years of financial services experience and is a Co-Founder and Managing Director of Journey Strategic Wealth LLC. Mike was previously a Senior Managing Director and member of the Investment Committee at Magnus Financial Group. At Dynasty Financial Partners, he was a Partner and Director of Wealth Management. Michael began his career as a financial consultant with Merrill Lynch, helped form the Special Equity Transactions Group at Bear Stearns and was head of the domestic Private Bank for ING Barings.
He earned his Bachelor of Arts in History with a minor in Anthropology from Columbia University and currently serves as Class Chair and sits on the President’s Committee on Athletics. Michael received All-Ivy League honors in both football and baseball. In addition, he serves on the Board of Hope & Heroes Children’s Cancer Fund at New York Presbyterian Hospital and is a Board Member of the Great Oaks Foundation.
Achievements:
At U.S. Trust, Bank of America Private Wealth Management, he was a Managing Director and Wealth Management Advisor. Michael has been quoted in various publications including InvestmentNews, Financial Planning, WM.com & Reuters.
Disclosure: Securities offered through Purshe Kaplan Sterling Investments, Member
FINRA

, Headquartered at 80 State Street, Albany NY 12207. Purshe Kaplan Sterling Investments and Journey Strategic Wealth are not affiliated companies. Not FDIC Insured. Not Bank Guaranteed. May lose value including loss of principal. Not insured by any state or federal agency.

back to top
Michael Brown is a director in BRG’s Corporate Finance practice and specializes in helping clients navigate complex financial and operational challenges during periods of extreme uncertainty.
His clients include management teams, boards of directors, equity sponsors, lenders, and unsecured creditors.
Mr. Brown has significant experience in transaction advisory, liquidity forecasting, working capital management, business plan development, identifying and implementing cost savings opportunities, and negotiating trade agreements.
Mr. Brown also has experience in developing complex financial models and forecasting tools that are flexible enough to be used during periods of complex transition.
Before joining BRG, Mr. Brown was part of the Corporate Finance & Restructuring practice at FTI.

Goal: Job Seeking (employment opportunities)

Please return:
1) A concise, specific subject line
2) A short email body (max ~200 words) that feels human, references shared interests or context, and ends with a clear but polite call to action.
output_generate_email:
Subject: Digital Marketing Expertise - John Carter

Dear Michael,

I came across your profile and noticed your extensive experience in corporate finance and wealth management, including roles at BRG and Journey Strategic Wealth.

I'm a marketing strategist with 6+ years of experience in digital marketing, brand development, and data-driven campaign optimization. My background includes leading digital advertising campaigns and designing brand positioning strategies, with a focus on improving market penetration.

I'm currently exploring opportunities in the Finance/Fintech space where I can leverage my expertise. Would you be open to a brief introductory call sometime next week to discuss how my skills and experience might align with your current or future initiatives?

Of course, if this isn't a good fit for you, please feel free to disregard.

Best regards,

John Carter
john.carter@example.com
+1 202 555 0134
linkedin.com/in/johncarter
